loadPatternNotes: The mappings from source to the landing (staging) area.

The Persistent Staging Area (PSA) is the foundation of the Virtual Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW). The ETL effectively compares and loads the delta into the PSA tables that correspond to the Staging Area counterparts. Because of this the logic is generated as 'SELECT INSERT' to load new data delta into this area.

The source-to-target mappings for a Hub entity type. The Hub entities define the business concept and integration point for the model. In the Virtual Data Warehouse, the generated views combine the metadata from the various source to target mappings to create a single integrated Hub query.

The Link type entities record the relationships between the Business Entities (Hubs). Similar to Hubs they are subject to potentially being populated from multiple Staging Area tables. The Link views therefore present an integrated view of all relationships across these tables.

LoadPatternSelectionQuery:
SELECT
  DISTINCT [TARGET_NAME]
FROM [interface].[INTERFACE_SOURCE_SATELLITE_XREF]
WHERE [TARGET_TYPE]='Normal'
ORDER BY [TARGET_NAME]
loadPatternNotes: The Satellite type entities capture (historical / time-variant) context about the Business Keys in the Hub entities. A Satellite is typically sourced from a single Staging Area table.

LoadPatternSelectionQuery:
SELECT
  DISTINCT [TARGET_NAME]
FROM [interface].[INTERFACE_SOURCE_SATELLITE_XREF] xref
WHERE [TARGET_TYPE]='Link Satellite'
AND NOT EXISTS
	(SELECT 1 
	 FROM [interface].[INTERFACE_DRIVING_KEY] dk
	 WHERE xref.[TARGET_NAME] = dk.[SATELLITE_NAME])
ORDER BY [TARGET_NAME]
loadPatternAdditionalBusinessKeyQuery:
SELECT
 stg.[SCHEMA_NAME] AS SOURCE_SCHEMA_NAME,
 xref.SOURCE_NAME,
 sat.[SCHEMA_NAME] AS [TARGET_SCHEMA_NAME],
 sat.SATELLITE_NAME AS [TARGET_NAME],
 'N/A' AS [HUB_NAME],
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_FROM] AS SOURCE_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION,
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_TO]  AS [TARGET_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION],
 sat.SATELLITE_TYPE AS [TARGET_TYPE],
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_TO] AS SURROGATE_KEY,
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_TO] AS TARGET_KEY_NAME
FROM MD_SOURCE_SATELLITE_XREF xref
JOIN MD_SOURCE stg ON xref.SOURCE_NAME = stg.SOURCE_NAME
JOIN MD_SATELLITE sat ON xref.SATELLITE_NAME = sat.SATELLITE_NAME
JOIN MD_HUB hub ON sat.HUB_NAME = hub.HUB_NAME
JOIN MD_LINK lnk ON sat.LINK_NAME = lnk.LINK_NAME
JOIN [MD_SOURCE_LINK_ATTRIBUTE_XREF] xreflink ON xreflink.[SOURCE_NAME] = stg.[SOURCE_NAME] AND xreflink.[LINK_NAME] = lnk.[LINK_NAME]
LEFT JOIN MD_SOURCE_HUB_XREF stghubxref
  ON xref.SOURCE_NAME = stghubxref.SOURCE_NAME
  AND hub.HUB_NAME = stghubxref.HUB_NAME
  AND xref.BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION = stghubxref.BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION
WHERE sat.SATELLITE_TYPE= 'Link Satellite'
loadPatternNotes: The Link Satellites describe the changes over time for the relationships (Links). This pattern supports normal (historical) Link Satellites.

LoadPatternSelectionQuery:
SELECT
  [SATELLITE_NAME] AS [TARGET_NAME]
FROM interface.INTERFACE_DRIVING_KEY
ORDER BY [SATELLITE_NAME]
loadPatternBaseQuery:
SELECT a.[SOURCE_SCHEMA_NAME]
      ,a.[SOURCE_NAME]
      ,a.[TARGET_SCHEMA_NAME]
      ,a.[TARGET_NAME]
      ,a.[SOURCE_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION]
      ,a.[TARGET_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION]
      ,a.[TARGET_TYPE]
      ,a.[SURROGATE_KEY]
      ,a.[FILTER_CRITERIA]
      ,a.[LOAD_VECTOR]
	  ,c.[SOURCE_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION] AS [DRIVING_KEY_SOURCE]
	  ,c.[TARGET_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION] AS [DRIVING_KEY_TARGET]
  FROM [interface].[INTERFACE_SOURCE_SATELLITE_XREF] a
  LEFT JOIN [interface].[INTERFACE_DRIVING_KEY] b ON a.TARGET_NAME = b.SATELLITE_NAME
  JOIN [interface].[INTERFACE_SOURCE_HUB_XREF] c ON b.HUB_NAME = c.TARGET_NAME AND a.SOURCE_NAME = c.SOURCE_NAME AND a.SOURCE_SCHEMA_NAME = c.SOURCE_SCHEMA_NAME
loadPatternAdditionalBusinessKeyQuery:
SELECT
 stg.[SCHEMA_NAME] AS SOURCE_SCHEMA_NAME,
 xref.SOURCE_NAME,
 sat.[SCHEMA_NAME] AS [TARGET_SCHEMA_NAME],
 sat.SATELLITE_NAME AS [TARGET_NAME],
 'N/A' AS [HUB_NAME],
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_FROM] AS SOURCE_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION,
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_TO]  AS [TARGET_BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION],
 sat.SATELLITE_TYPE AS [TARGET_TYPE],
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_TO] AS SURROGATE_KEY,
 [ATTRIBUTE_NAME_TO] AS TARGET_KEY_NAME
FROM MD_SOURCE_SATELLITE_XREF xref
JOIN MD_SOURCE stg ON xref.SOURCE_NAME = stg.SOURCE_NAME
JOIN MD_SATELLITE sat ON xref.SATELLITE_NAME = sat.SATELLITE_NAME
JOIN MD_HUB hub ON sat.HUB_NAME = hub.HUB_NAME
JOIN MD_LINK lnk ON sat.LINK_NAME = lnk.LINK_NAME
JOIN [MD_SOURCE_LINK_ATTRIBUTE_XREF] xreflink ON xreflink.[SOURCE_NAME] = stg.[SOURCE_NAME] AND xreflink.[LINK_NAME] = lnk.[LINK_NAME]
LEFT JOIN MD_SOURCE_HUB_XREF stghubxref
  ON xref.SOURCE_NAME = stghubxref.SOURCE_NAME
  AND hub.HUB_NAME = stghubxref.HUB_NAME
  AND xref.BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION = stghubxref.BUSINESS_KEY_DEFINITION
WHERE sat.SATELLITE_TYPE= 'Link Satellite'
loadPatternNotes: The Driving Key pattern for Link Satellites is an implementation of effective-dating relationships.
